tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE employee_profiles (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    department VARCHAR(100),
    skills VARCHAR(255),
    certifications VARCHAR(255),
    training VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE employees (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(255),
    position VARCHAR(255),
    department VARCHAR(255),
    skills VARCHAR(255),
    certifications VARCHAR(255),
    training_program VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE employee_skills (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    skill_name VARCHAR(255),
    proficiency_level VARCHAR(255),
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(id)
);

CREATE TABLE EmployeeProfiles (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    first_name VARCHAR(50),
    last_name VARCHAR(50),
    department VARCHAR(50),
    hire_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE Certifications (
    certification_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    certification_name VARCHAR(50),
    employee_id INT,
    expiration_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES EmployeeProfiles(employee_id)
);

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    first_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    last_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE NOT NULL,
    phone_number VARCHAR(20),
    hire_date DATE NOT NULL
);
